content:
That's fantastic! It sounds like you had a great experience with the workshop. Working with a experienced comedian as an instructor can be incredibly valuable, as they can share their own insights and expertise to help you improve your craft.

Learning how to structure a joke is a crucial part of writing stand-up comedy, and it's great that you got to practice that in the workshop. Coming up with new material can be a challenge, but having a guided process can really help. The fact that you were able to write five new jokes during the workshop is a great accomplishment!

Now, the next step is to try out those new jokes on stage and see how they land. Remember to be open to feedback and willing to make adjustments as needed. It's all part of the process of refining your craft and finding your unique voice.

What's your plan for trying out these new jokes? Are you going to start with an open mic night or a smaller show, or do you have a bigger gig lined up?

Also, what did you find most helpful about the workshop? Was there a particular exercise or piece of advice that really stood out to you?
